definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]

sentences.english: For Darwin, mate choice simply stopped at copulation.
sentences.chinese: 对达尔文来说，择偶仅仅停留在交尾。

sentences.english: Mating preferences, too, vary with a society’s level of economic development.
sentences.chinese: 择偶的选择也随一个社会的经济发展水平而变化。

definition: to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
the families are well-matched in terms of social status (idiom)/(of a prospective marriage partner) an appropriate match
older (than average in a group, at school, for marriage etc)
length of married life/marriageable age/actual marrying age
(Internet slang) guy who grew up in the countryside and gained a foothold in the city through hard work
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
